article.headline: Georgia Southern 83, Elon University 80 (OT)
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. (AP) -- Terry Williams scored a career-high 27 points and made seven 3-pointers, including one from about 35-feet at the end of regulation that tied the score, and Georgia Southern rallied to beat Elon 83-80 Monday night in overtime. Reserve Kordel Gibson added 15 points and Frank Bennett had 14 for the Eagles (20-6, 11-4 Southern Conference), who reached 20 wins for the first time since 1991-92. They took a half-game lead over idle College of Charleston in the South Division of the conference. The Phoenix (10-17, 6-9) blew a 17-point lead in the second half to lose for the third time in the past four games. Montell Watson came off the bench to score 23 points, and Jackson Atoyebi had 18 points and 11 rebounds. Matt Nowlin scored to give Elon a 74-71 lead with eight seconds left in regulation before Williams hit his tying 3 with one second left. Georgia Southern never trailed in overtime, immediately taking the lead on a jumper by Elton Nesbitt. After Watson tied it again with a layup, Bennett made a hook and added a free throw to help the Eagles take control. Williams blocked a 3-pointer by Nowlin just before the buzzer that would have tied it again.
